column4: I have a laptop which currently has FC1 installed on it, and I'd like to install Ubuntu on to it. The system won't boot from the CD drive, and it has no floppy drive, ideas?
can it boot from a usb?
it wont boot because it never had or it does not have a cdrom?
you can attempt a network install..assuming your nic card can handle boot over pxe
I can't get the network card working. :/
it seems about time for a newer laptop..
I'm looking for a cheap fix
then make sure your box forwards
then make sure your box forwards  .. cat 1 > /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward
I get permission denied running that command, even with sudo?
as root, check if that /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ip_forward is set to one, you can cat it
I removed the > 1, and it ran, and returned a 1
then next make sure the NATing is working so it can translate the ip address between internal and external
